docs.snippet: Latin-American writing is relentlessly moving to the center of the world's literary scene and such novelties as Gabriel Garcia Marquez and Ernesto Sabato have displayed "greater vitality and imagination than anything since the great Russian novels"...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin-American writing is relentlessly moving to the center of the world's literary scene and such novelties as Gabriel Garcia Marquez and Ernesto Sabato have displayed "greater vitality and imagination than anything since the great Russian novels" of the 19th century, according to Pablo Neruda, Chile's Nobel Prize-winning poet.
docs.abstract: Chilean poet and Nobel laureate P Neruda discusses new trends in writing of Latin Amer, which he says is becoming dominant in literary scene, Apr 13 lecture at Columbia Univ

headline.main: Neruda Hails New Gains In Latin Literary Trends

docs.snippet: President Juan Maria Bordaberry of Uruguay started his five-year term in office at the beginning of last month with a pledge of all-out war against the Tupamaros, the oldest and best-organized urban guerrillas in Latin America. For eight years the...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan Maria Bordaberry of Uruguay started his five-year term in office at the beginning of last month with a pledge of all-out war against the Tupamaros, the oldest and best-organized urban guerrillas in Latin America. For eight years the Tupamaros have fed on Uruguay's chronic economic unrest to win support for their efforts to overthrow successive governments.
docs.abstract: comment on Uruguayan pol crisis resulting from Tupamaro escalation of guerrilla activities

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 17 (AP) -- Soldiers fought a predawn battle today around a district office of the Communist party and seven civilians were killed, an official communique said.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 17 (AP) -- Soldiers fought a predawn battle today around a district office of the Communist party and seven civilians were killed, an official communique said.
docs.abstract: 7 civilians killed on Apr 17 in guerrilla war, Montevideo, raising to 19 number slain in fighting that started Apr 14 between leftists and Uruguayan Govt forces; scene of fighting illus; official rept is issued 17 hrs after fight erupted in Paso Molino residential dist; earlier repts from witnesses said 9 were killed, including army capt; newspapers and radio stations are prevented from reptg battle because of censorship imposed after Cong approved, on Apr 15, 30-day 'internal war against Tupamaros; conflicting versions of shooting detailed

headline.main: 17 More Die in Uruguay's Guerrilla War

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 (AP) -- Communist-controlled unions began a two-day general strike for higher wages today while the party buried seven of its members killed in a battle with the police.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 (AP) -- Communist-controlled unions began a two-day general strike for higher wages today while the party buried seven of its members killed in a battle with the police.
docs.abstract: Communist-controlled unions begin 2-day gen strike for higher wages on Apr 18 while party buries 7 comrades killed in battle with police; unions originally called for 14-hr strike but extended it to protest battle at Communist party dist hq on previous day which broke out when Govt contended that Tupamaros took refuge in bldg; Communists, who oppose terrorist tactics of Tupamaros, deny charges; Govt communique later does not assert that Tupamaros had been inside bldg, says police wished to investigate rept that gun had been thrown from bldg and that those inside opened fire; neighborhood residents insist that Army began shooting and that it fired on bldg for over an hr

headline.main: Uruguayan Reds Bury 7 Dead, Begin a 2-Day General Strike

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO -- For six miles they marched solemnly to the cemetery. First the red-shirted Communist shock troops with their arms tautly linked, then the crowd of 40,000 mourners. In a country where the daring Tupamaro urban terrorists have monopolized...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO -- For six miles they marched solemnly to the cemetery. First the red-shirted Communist shock troops with their arms tautly linked, then the crowd of 40,000 mourners. In a country where the daring Tupamaro urban terrorists have monopolized revolutionary violence, the stodgy, nonviolent, Moscow-line Communist party, which soberly marked its 50th birthday last year, had its first modern martyrs.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Communist party mourns its 1st modern martyrs, 7 youths killed on Apr 17; Govt says youths died while shooting to protect Tupamaros they were hiding in their Montevideo clubhouse but Communist party denies Tupamaro presence and insists youths were killed without cause; differences between Tupamaro and Communist programs and actions discussed; Communists see Tupamaros as middle-class intellectual elitists who disdain workers while Communists have their strength in labor and student orgns; other differences detailed; in addition to econ chaos, Pres Bordaberry now faces new challenge of Tupamaros and increased hostility of Communists

headline.main: Making Martyrs For the Communists; Uruguay:

docs.snippet: legis sources, Montevideo, speculate that Gutierrez had accepted invitation by Tupamaro guerrillas to investigate their charges that mil and police extremists had formed vigilante 'death squad'; say Gutierrez left his house with 3 armed guerrillas,...
docs.abstract: legis sources, Montevideo, speculate that Gutierrez had accepted invitation by Tupamaro guerrillas to investigate their charges that mil and police extremists had formed vigilante 'death squad'; say Gutierrez left his house with 3 armed guerrillas, leaving behind lr saying he is on strictly 'informative' mission and requesting authorities not to search for him

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 (UPI) -- Tupamaro guerrillas kidnapped Hector Gutierrez Ruiz, president of the Chamber of Deputies, tonight, Senator Almbert Vaz said.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 (UPI) -- Tupamaro guerrillas kidnapped Hector Gutierrez Ruiz, president of the Chamber of Deputies, tonight, Senator Almbert Vaz said.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros kidnap Chamber of Deputies pres H Gutierrez Ruiz, Montevideo; Sen Vaz says Tupamaro message indicates they intend to hold Gutierrez 48 hrs and to make him act as 'judge advocate' in 'people's prison'; says Gutierrez will hear kidnapped police photographer N Bardesio denounce existence of alleged police 'death squads'; Bardesio reptdly is author of 4 lrs distributed by guerrillas giving details of 'death squads' activities

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 (UPI) -- Left-wing Tupamaro guerrillas freed the president of the Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies today, less than 24 hours after he was kidnapped to hear the testimony of a Tupamaro prisoner.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 (UPI) -- Left-wing Tupamaro guerrillas freed the president of the Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies today, less than 24 hours after he was kidnapped to hear the testimony of a Tupamaro prisoner.
docs.abstract: kidnapped Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies pres Gutierrez freed by Tupamaros Apr 25 after he hears testimony of Tupamaro prisoner, police photographer N Bardesio, who reptdly confessed to membership in police 'death squad' that kills suspected subversives; says he believes Bardesio is telling truth

headline.main: Kidnapped Official Freed By Uruguayan Guerrillas

docs.snippet: Although two world-championship offshore powerboat events have been held -- in Uruguay and Argentina -- the season never seems official until you hear the words, Sam Griffith Memorial Race.
docs.lead_paragraph: Although two world-championship offshore powerboat events have been held -- in Uruguay and Argentina -- the season never seems official until you hear the words, Sam Griffith Memorial Race.

headline.main: Sam Griffith Race Begins on Friday; FORT LAUDERDALE IS STARTING SPOT Rautbord Holds Point Lead for Griffith Trophy, but Balestrieri Is Close

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 11 -An oil tanker and a British cargo ship collided in the entrance to the River Plate channel, 90 miles east of here, today. Both vessels were destroyed by flames and 83 people were reported missing.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 11 -An oil tanker and a British cargo ship collided in the entrance to the River Plate channel, 90 miles east of here, today. Both vessels were destroyed by flames and 83 people were reported missing.
docs.abstract: Royston Grange (Freighter) and Tien Chee (Tanker): Brit cargo ship Royston Grange, carrying 10 passengers and crew of 63, and Liberian-flag tanker Tien Chee, carrying 20,000 tons of crude oil and crew of 40, collide in dense fog and burn near entrance to River Plate channel, Buenos Aires, May 11; Argentine maritime police rept rescue of 32 persons, mostly members of Tien Chee crew, noting there is no clear information on 74 persons from Royston Grange; extinguish oil fire with chemicals, adding that danger of oil pollution to Uruguayan coast still remains; illus of burning ships

headline.main: 83 Are Missing as Cargo Ship and Tanker Collide Off Uruguay and Burn
